wrong_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE name LIKE John
correct_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE name LIKE 'John';

wrong_query: INSERT INTO users id, name VALUES (1, 'A')

correct_query: UPDATE users SET name = 'X' WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM A JOIN B ON A.id = B.id;

wrong_query: SELECT * FROM A INNER B ON A.id=B.id
correct_query: SELECT * FROM A INNER JOIN B ON A.id = B.id;

wrong_query: SELECT * FROM A LEFT B ON A.id=B.id
correct_query: SELECT * FROM A LEFT JOIN B ON A.id = B.id;
SELECT department, COUNT(*) FROM employees GROUP BY department;

wrong_query: SELECT department SUM(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department
correct_query: SELECT department, SUM(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department;

wrong_query: SELECT department, COUNT(*) FROM employees HAVING COUNT(*) > 2
correct_query: SELECT department, COUNT(*) FROM employees GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(*) > 2;
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY name;
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY name;

wrong_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE id IN SELECT id FROM orders
correct_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE id IN (SELECT id FROM orders);
SELECT name AS username FROM users;

wrong_query: CREATE TABLE users id INT, name VARCHAR(100)
correct_query: CREATE TABLE users (id INT, name VARCHAR(100));
ALTER TABLE users ADD age INT;
ALTER TABLE users ADD age INT;

wrong_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE age BETWEEN 10 AND
correct_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE age BETWEEN 10 AND 20;

wrong_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE id IN 1,2,3
correct_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE id IN (1,2,3);

wrong_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE name = NULL
correct_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE name IS NULL;

wrong_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE EXISTS SELECT 1 FROM orders
correct_query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM orders);

wrong_query: CREATE VIEW v1 SELECT * FROM users
correct_query: CREATE VIEW v1 AS SELECT * FROM users;
